title: Slide rule scale
summary: A slide rule scale is a line with graduated markings  inscribed along the length of a slide rule used for mathematical calculations. The earliest such device had a single logarithmic scale for performing multiplication and division but soon an improved technique was developed which involved two such scales sliding alongside each other â€“ hence the name slide rule (colloquially called a slipstick in the United States). Later, multiple scales were provided with the most basic being logarithmic but with others graduated according to the mathematical function required.
